result.execSummary:
The defendant Lewis H Sims was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Lewis H Sims
Current: 333 Jackson Court #2, Waukesha, WI 53186 United States  (Effective: 10-09-2014)
Prior: 1519 Summit Ave, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
regarding treatment
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Lewis H Sims in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Margaret Drees appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed an Amended Information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:

Count 1:
- Sentence withheld.  Credit for 3 days if revoked.
- 1 year 6 months Probation. 
- Court costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of Probation:  Follow through with additional family counseling and mental health counseling.  Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.
CONDITION TIME: 30 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - STAYED for use by Agent.

Count 2:
- Sentence withheld.  Credit for 3 days if revoked.
- 1 year 6 months Probation. 
- Court costs waived.
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- Conditions of Probation:  Same as Count 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defense requests plea and sentencing in about 8 weeks.  Defendant updates address as of 8/11/14.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
